content: The inconvenient truth about the US-bound migrant caravan

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div ul li time span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p a span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: priorities has thrown further doubt over the future of the US' 800,000 "Dreamers".

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: The plans, revealed by the White House in October, tie future legal protection of "Dreamer" immigrants to funding for Trump's controversial border wall with Mexico and increased spending on immigration enforcement officers.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Al Jazeera answers some of the key questions about some of those who may be facing deportation as a result of the US president's recent announcements.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div div table tbody tr td div span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: The Dreamers are some 800,000 undocumented immigrants who came to the US as children.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: They have been permitted to stay in the country because of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) legislation introduced in 2012 by former US President Barack Obama.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Most Dreamers arrived in the US from Mexico and other parts of Central and South America. On average, they entered the US at the age of six-and-a-half. About 200,000 live in California;

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: almost 115,000 are in Texas and more than 30,000 live in New York, a

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span span
content: ccording to US Immigration and Citizenship Services.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Many also reside in Illinois and Florida.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: DACA, created by former US President Barack Obama in 2012, protects by law young immigrants who were mostly raised in the US but arrived in the country undocumented.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: The programme protects Dreamers from deportation, granting them a two-year period of amnesty that can be extended with a work permit and social security number.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Recipients of the programme's safeguarding must have no criminal record, proof they were brought to the US before the age of 16, were under 31 years of age when the programme was launched, and be at least 15 years old when applying to invoke its protection.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p a span
content: READ MORE: Texas police arrest DACA recipients in Austin protest

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Applicants must also be students, or have completed school or undertaken military service.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: The application cost is nearly $500, and permits must be renewed every two years. The application and renewal process takes several weeks.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: DACA does not give beneficiaries legal US residency. Those who pass the vetting process receive temporary reprieves from deportation and a temporary permission to work.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: DACA was created by Obama following intense pressure from advocates who wanted protections put in place for young immigrants who had been mostly raised in the US but lacked citizenship.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: After repeated failures to pass the "Dream Act" - which would have provided a path to citizenship for those who later became DACA beneficiaries - the Obama administration revealed DACA on June 15, 2012.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
content: What's impact do 'Dreamers' have on the US?

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: According to a study by the University of California, San Diego, Dreamers have had a positive impact on the US economy. Some 97 percent of DACA recipients are employed or in school. They open firms and buy cars and homes and are predicted to boost the US economy by $460bn over the next decade.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: At least 72 percent of the top 25 Fortune 500 companies employ Dreamers, meaning that phasing out DACA will likely force big firms to spend time and cash recruiting new talent, Tom Wong, the author of the University of California study told Al Jazeera.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
content: What does Trump say about DACA?

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Trump promised to revoke the DACA legislation during the 2016 presidential election, as part of his vow to make cracking down on the US’ estimated 11 million undocumented immigrants a top priority of his administration.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: In early September, the Trump administration moved to scrap the programme, giving Congress six months to come to a political solution before DACA officially ends.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: In October, Trump sent Congress a list of immigration demands that he said must be tied to any legislation related to DACA.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: The legislative agenda includes measures to ban immigrants from bringing extended family members to the US,

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: constructing a border wall with Mexico and

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: penalising the country's "sanctuary cities", those cities and states that that limit cooperation with federal immigration authorities in an effort to help reduce the number of deportations.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p a span
content: READ MORE: American dream fades for child immigrants under Trump

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: "These findings outline reforms that must be included as part of any legislation addressing the status of Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals recipients," Trump wrote in a letter to Congress accompanying the list.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: This follows Trump's announcement last month the White House would begin "an orderly, lawful wind down" of DACA.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: As DACA was created by executive order, President Trump has the power to reverse the policy should he choose to do so.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
content: Who is pushing back against Trump's policies?

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Trump's recently announced immigration policy priorities have drawn criticism from political opponents and advocacy groups, as well as from some within Trump's own party.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: Top democrats have rallied against the policy with Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, and Congress Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi labelling Trump’s plans as "far beyond what is reasonable".

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: "The Administration can't be serious about compromise or helping the Dreamers if they begin with a list that is anathema to the Dreamers, to the immigrant community and to the vast majority of Americans," they said in a joint statement released Sunday.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: "We told the President at our meeting that we were open to reasonable border security measures alongside the DREAM Act, but this … proposal fails to represent any attempt at compromise," they added.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div h2 span
html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: The deadline for DACA recipients to renew their status and be granted two more years of stay in the US ended on September 7.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div p span
content: If Congress fails to negotiate an agreement based on Trump's new legislative measures, or unless the president changes his policy plans, DACA recipients, who were unable to renew their status, could face deportation as early as March 2018.

tag: html body form div div div div div div div section div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div div article div div div table tbody tr td div span
content: WATCH: US immigration: Thousands of dreamers could lose protection as deadline DACA looms
